forms.inviteUserTooltip:
The "Invite user" feature requires that SMTP or SES is configured in order to send invitation emails.

SMTP can be configured in Settings > Organization settings.
forms.editEmailTooltip:
Editing an email address requires that SMTP or SES is configured in order to send a validation email.

Users with Admin role can configure SMTP in Settings > Organization settings.
forms.ssoNotEnabled:
SSO is not enabled in organization settings.
User must sign in with a password.
forms.passwordHelp: 12-48 characters, with at least 1 number (e.g. 0 - 9) and 1 symbol (e.g. &*#).
forms.temporaryPasswordTooltip:
This password is temporary. This user will be asked to set a new password after logging in to the Fleet UI.

This user will not be asked to set a new password after logging in to fleetctl or the Fleet API.
forms.twoFactorAuthHelp: User will be asked to authenticate with a magic link that will be sent to their email.
forms.twoFactorAuthTooltip:
This feature requires that SMTP or SES is configured in order to send authentication emails.

SMTP can be configured in Settings > Organization settings.

apple.title: Apple MDM
apple.turnOffError: Couldn't turn off MDM. Please try again.

setup.description: Connect Fleet to Apple Push Certificates Portal to turn on MDM.
setup.step1: Download a certificate signing request (CSR) for Apple Push Notification service (APNs).
setup.step2End: If you don't have an Apple ID, select Create yours now.
setup.step3: In Apple Push Certificates Portal, select Create a Certificate, upload your CSR, and download your APNs certificate.
setup.downloadError: Something's gone wrong. Please try again.

renew.step1: 1. Download a certificate signing request (CSR) for Apple Push Notification service (APNs).
renew.step3: 3. In Apple Push Certificates Portal, select Renew next to your certificate (make sure that the certificate's Common Name (CN) matches the one presented in Fleet).
renew.step4: 4. Upload your CSR and download new APNs certificate.
renew.downloadError: Something's gone wrong. Please try again.

turnOffModal.title: Turn off MDM
turnOffModal.message: If you want to use MDM features again, you'll have to upload a new APNs certificate and all end users will have to turn MDM off and back on.

android.title: Android MDM
android.connectDescription: Connect Android Enterprise to turn on Android MDM.
android.turnOnError: Couldn't turn on Android MDM. Please try again.
android.connectErrorExists: Couldn't connect. Android enterprise already exists for this Fleet server. For help, please contact
android.turnOffModalWarning1: If you want to use MDM features again, you'll have to reconnect Android Enterprise.
android.turnOffModalWarning2: End users will lose access to organization resources and all data in their Android work partition.
android.turnOffError: Couldn't turn off Android MDM. Please try again.

windows.title: Windows MDM
windows.descriptionOn: Turns on MDM for Windows hosts that enroll to Fleet (excluding servers).
windows.descriptionOff: Hosts with MDM already turned on will not have MDM removed.
windows.automaticHelp: MDM is turned on when Fleet's agent is installed on Windows hosts (excluding servers).
windows.manualHelpEnd: End users have to manually turn on MDM in Settings > Access work or school.
windows.autoMigrate: Automatically migrate hosts connected to another MDM solution
windows.entraDescription: The end user will see Microsoft's default initial setup. You can further simplify the initial device setup with Autopilot, which is similar to Apple's Automated Device Enrollment (DEP).
windows.entraWarning1: Some Intune/Entra deployments enable automatic enrollment into Intune. Check to ensure Automatic Enrollment is not enabled, or your devices will not appear in Fleet.
windows.entraWarning2: In your Intune settings, select Devices, and under Device onbarding, open the Enrollment submenu. Select Automatic Enrollment and ensure both MDM user scope and Windows Information Protection (WIP) user scope are set to None.
windows.entraStep2: At the top of the page, search "Domain names" and select Domain names. Then select + Add custom domain, type your Fleet URL (e.g. fleet.acme.com), and select Add domain.
windows.entraStep3: Use the information presented in Azure AD to create a new TXT/MX record with your domain registrar, then select Verify.
windows.entraCloudBanner: If you're a managed-cloud customer, please reach out to Fleet to create a TXT/MX record for you.
windows.entraStep4: At the top of the page, search for "Mobility" and select Mobility (MDM and WIP).
windows.entraStep5: Select + Add application, then select + Create your own application.
windows.entraStep6: Enter "Fleet" as the name of your application and select Create.
windows.entraStep7: Set MDM user scope to All, then copy the URLs below, paste them in Azure AD, and select Save.
windows.mdmTermsOfUseTooltip: The terms of use URL is used to display the terms of service to end users before turning on MDM their host. The terms of use text informs users about policies that will be enforced on the host.
windows.mdmDiscoveryTooltip: The enrollment URL is used to connect hosts with the MDM service.
windows.entraStep8: While on this same page, select Custom MDM application settings link.
windows.entraStep9: Click on the Application ID URI which will bring you to the Expose an API submenu with an edit button next to the text box.
windows.entraStep10: Replace with your Fleet URL (e.g. fleet.acme.com) and select Save.
windows.entraStep11: Select API permissions from the sidebar, then select + Add a permission.
windows.entraStep12: Select Microsoft Graph, then select Delegated permissions, and select Group > Group.Read.All and Group > Group.ReadWrite.All and Add permissions.
windows.entraStep13: Again select + Add a permission and then Microsoft Graph and Application permissions, select the following:
windows.entraStep15: Select Grant admin consent for <your tenant name>, and confirm.
windows.entraStep16: You're ready to automatically enroll Windows hosts to Fleet.
